Title of your ticket: Training dataset contains unsanitized personal contact details
Write your ticket: While performing a routine audit of customer_feedback_training_v4.csv I discovered multiple rows that still contain personally identifying information: full names, personal email addresses and several phone numbers in the contact_info column. The file was supposedly anonymized before ingestion into our feature store, but these rows appear to be original raw records that slipped through. I sampled 250 rows and found ~12 rows with obvious PII. This is a potential compliance risk if that dataset was used for any offline model training or shared across teams. Could someone (a) confirm whether a sanitized copy exists, (b) temporarily remove the public share link, and (c) advise whether we should trigger a re-training notification for models that used this dataset between Aug 10–Sep 02?

Title of your ticket: Model deployment pipeline fails at Docker build
Write your ticket: The continuous deployment job deploy-llm-service failed repeatedly during the Docker build step on Jenkins agent build-12. The failure message indicates ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'torch' when python -c "import torch" is executed inside the image. The Dockerfile uses python:3.10-slim as base and installs requirements from requirements.txt. My suspicion: the base image lacks the correct wheel infrastructure or we are pinning incompatible CUDA/PyTorch versions. The build log snippet:

Title of your ticket: Edge AI kit: 2× Raspberry Pi 5, 2× Coral USB accelerators and accessories
Write your ticket: Our edge-prototyping subgroup requests the following items to build an on-device speech recognition prototype: 	2 × Raspberry Pi 5 (8 GB variant) 	2 × Coral USB Edge TPUs (for accelerating TFLite models) 	2 × 128 GB high-endurance microSD cards 	Passive heatsinks and small-case enclosures with ventilation 	Reason: we need to benchmark offline keyword spotting latency and power consumption for the field device. Please include recommended suppliers and lead times; if discounts exist for academic or volume purchases, those would be appreciated.

Title of your ticket: New high-performance dev workstation to run local experiments
Write your ticket: My current development laptop cannot handle practical on-device training or local model builds. Request approval to procure a new developer workstation configured with: AMD Ryzen Threadripper (or Intel Xeon equivalent), 64 GB DDR5 RAM, 2 × 1 TB NVMe in RAID-1, a high-end GPU (e.g., RTX 5090), and a 27” 4K monitor. Use case: local model compilation, dataset preprocessing and interactive debugging of large experiments. Happy to provide exact SKU preferences and justification for the ROI (reduced cloud costs, improved developer throughput). Please advise next steps for procurement and whether we should open a CAPEX ticket.

Title of your ticket: Mobile app crashes when opening camera
Write your ticket: Hi Mobile Team, opening the camera inside the app causes an immediate crash on Android 12 devices. Error occurs when tapping “Scan Document.” Repro: open app → tap Scan → app closes. Logs show a camera permission exception on some devices though permissions are granted. Need a fix or safer permission check.

Hello, when exporting reports to PDF, embedded images are missing or replaced with placeholders. Text exports fine. Repro: open monthly report with screenshots → Export → download PDF → images not included. Might be related to image encoding or external CDN fetch.

Title of your ticket: Incorrect error message shown on permission denied
Write your ticket: Hi Support, when a user without access tries to view a resource, the app shows “Resource not found” instead of “Permission denied.” This misleads users. Please return 403 with a clear message so users understand it’s a permissions issue.

The “Submit Request” button remains disabled on the form even when all required fields are filled. No validation messages appear. Users assume bug. Repro: fill form completely and button is gray. Need client-side validation messages or enable the button.

Some users mentioned that their voice commands on the mobile assistant sometimes appear to be stored, although they thought they had turned off the “Record history” option. It’s unclear whether this happens consistently or only for certain features like reminders or search queries. Also, the app shows notifications about recent activity which might confuse users, and logs may or may not include the exact phrases spoken. We should investigate whether the data is actually saved anywhere and review how the documentation explains this behavior, because some users reported mixed experiences with both Android and iOS devices.
